item.title: Favorite Media of 2022
item.author: Noah Jacobus
item.description:
Tangentially related to my Enjoyment Roundups, I thought it’d be fun to go through various media I most enjoyed this past year.

Films

Having a kid really changes your media habits, not to mention the whole ongoing global pandemic thing. So I didn’t get out to ye olde cineplex as much as I have in the past.

  1. Everything Everywhere All at Once
  2. Nope
  3. After Yang
  4. Glass Onion
  5. Turning Red

Music

  1. Alluvium by C Duncan
  2. Fire Seed by Phabies
  3. Brothertiger by Brothertiger
  4. Special by Lizzo
  5. Second Nature by Lucius

Television

If you listen to the podcast Wonderful, you’ve heard Griffin McElroy say that this may be the best year of television in recent memory — and I’m inclined to agree.

  1. Station Eleven on HBOMax (for now)
  2. Severance on Apple TV+
  3. Andor on Disney+
  4. The Bear on Hulu
  5. Our Flag Means Death on HBOMax (for now)
Honorable mention to everything on Dropout, which IMO is the best bang for your buck you can get with a streaming service. Dimension 20, Game Changer, Play It By Ear, Dirty Laundry, to name a few.

Video Games

  1. Tunic (Mac)
  2. Horizon Forbidden West (PS5)
  3. God of War Ragnarök (PS5)
  4. Inscryption (PS5)
  5. Bloom (Playdate)

Podcasts

My doing-the-dishes and riding-the-bus entertainment of choice.

  1. Off Book (which has a Gamechanger and Dropout spinoff show you should absolutely watch)
  2. The Playdate Podcast
  3. Wonderful!
  4. My Brother, My Brother & Me
  5. Dungeons & Daddies

item.title: Enjoyment Roundup 001
item.author: Noah Jacobus
item.description:
So I’ve already been doing this for a bit on Twitter, but I figured a longer form version with additional context could be fun. I don’t really have a regular cadence for this in mind — basically whenever I’ve experienced enough different things across various media that pique my interest.

  • 📖 Twenty Bits I Learned About Making Websites by Dan Cederholm

    I’ve been a Dan Fan™ for a long while, and have really enjoyed his previous releases in this series. There’s lots of fun little nuggets, but as he says “This is not a book about code.” More of a trip down memory lane to the early days of web standards with some timeless lessons.

  • 🎵 Pollen by Tennis

    Sure the album doesn’t come out ‘til February 10, but I still keep listening to the same 2 released tracks over and over. I keep 2020’s Swimmer on regular rotation as-is, so I can’t wait to for new Tennis tunes to fill my ear holes.

  • 📺 Willow

    I didn’t grow up with Ron Howard’s 1988 original flick Willow, but I caught it as an adult a few years ago and found it quite charming (doesn’t hurt that Warwick Davis is always a win). I was worried this series would play the usual “soft reboot, same cast 30+ years later, *wink wink nudge nudge* nostalgia card” that’s plagued so many IPs lately; but my wife and I have really enjoyed it! Has its own tone and frequently made us laugh out loud.

  • ⌨️ Tofu65 with Anthracite Silent Tactiles

    The trusty ol’ Tofu was my first real mechanical keyboard, and it’s still the most portable one I own. Because of that, it’s also the one I take with me to The Factory on coworking days. I’m not a heavy typer, but I’m always keeping my ears on a swivel for making too much noise in public spaces. Lo and behold my delight when Mode, some of my favorite keyboard folks, released a silent tactile switch for quiet clackin’. They’re surprisingly good stock, and I haven’t heard any complaints from my desk neighbors.

item.title: Writing in the Open
item.author: Noah Jacobus
item.description:
Well hello there, new friend. This blog may not look like much yet, but I wanted to get a space set up sooner rather than later for my forthcoming thoughts. And while the paint may change, the bones will stay the same — so why not go ahead and move in?

Some potential posts coming down the pipe:

  • “Job Awesome” (reflections on one year at Font Awesome)
  • “Fundamentals of Icon Design v2” (cleaning up writing, new visual examples, dropping the MetaLab project narrative framing)
  • “Clicksy Business” (getting into the mechanical keyboard hobby)
  • “We Got the Chunk” (the ups, downs, and more ups of making and maintaining Chunk icons)

Anything else you’d like to hear about? Gimme a hearty shout on The Bird, The Elephant, or good old electronic mail.
